text.text_translated:
Most spiders have venom. Venom is a special liquid. Spiders use this venom to stun or kill their food, not to attack people.
Only 25 types of spiders have venom that can really hurt people. Spider bites can hurt. But they nearly never kill people.
The Sydney funnel-web spider is from Australia. People think it is very dangerous. But it has not killed anyone since 1981. This is because anti-venom was made in 1981. Anti-venom is a special medicine for venom.
But be careful with hairy spiders like tarantulas. Do not bother them. When they feel danger, they protect themselves. They throw out a cloud of hairs. These hairs make you itch. The hairs stick in your skin or eyes.

Most spiders have venom. Venom is a special liquid. They use it to stun or kill their food. They do not use it to attack people.

Only 25 known types of spiders have venom that can truly harm people. Spider bites can hurt. But they almost never kill people.

The Sydney funnel-web spider is a very dangerous spider from Australia. It has not killed anyone since 1981. This is because anti-venom was made in 1981. Anti-venom is a special medicine for venom.

Be careful with hairy spiders like tarantulas. Do not make them angry. When they feel danger, they protect themselves. They throw out special hairs that make you itch. These hairs can stick in your skin or eyes.
